reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 5, 2024
reviews.reviewText: Another hit! This story is full of emotions and passion that will keep you captivated from the beginning. I loved the characters, the connection and the chemistry. It’s an entertaining and lighthearted story.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 12, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Emotional and Sensual Secret Baby Romance ❤
reviews.reviewText: Bo Sorenson is a world renowned yacht designer who is beyond shocked when he's named guardian to a son that he never knew existed. He can anticipate and work with his clients relentless demands but what does he know about a baby? He needs to get some help right away Olivia Cooper is still haunted by her last assignment so this will be her last summer in Denmark working as a nanny. When she gets the assignment for Bo and his son she tells herself that she's not going to let herself get too close to Bo or his son but the heated way that he looks at her doesn't make it easy. I don't want to say anymore and ruin it for anyone else with spoilers. You really need to read this emotional, sensual, secret baby romance full of chemistry, drama and passion to see what happens. I would recommend reading this book.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 14, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars You will fall in love with Olivia and Bo!
reviews.reviewText: Olivia has so much inner turmoil as her last nanny position is here due to her promise to her parents to return at the end of five years to work in the family business even though she has no desire to work in their field. Enter workaholic Bo who is now the parent of a son he knew nothing about nor how to care for him. Olivia and Bo’s first interaction starts the undeniable and forbidden attraction between employee and employer, something neither of them have ever stepped over the boundary. Yet lines are made to be broken with the illusion that when Olivia’s time is up, they will walk away from their explosive chemistry. How will it all end? You have to read to find out!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewText: A great escape read from Joss Wood. A Billionaire/Nanny trope featuring Bo Sorenson, a yacht designer who discovers he has a son. Out of his comfort zone looking after a child, between his demanding job & his clients, he needs a nanny.Olivia is at a crossroads and determines Bo will be her last nanny job in Denmark. Can they keep this job professional?As with all of this author’s books, an emotional journey with passion, drama, in a contemporary romance.Thank you to Booksprout and the Author for the advanced copy; this is my voluntary review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 13, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Hired for the Billionaire's Secret Son
reviews.reviewText: Hired for the Billionaire's Secret Son. This is Bo and Ollie's story. Bo just find out he has a son and needs help with him because he doesn't know what to do. He hires Ollie to help and teach him about what to do with his son. The more they're together the stronger the attraction. Bo's not ready to commit and Ollie feels obligated to return home to work for her parents. Can love bring them together. Must read and see what happens.I received a free copy of this book via Booksprout and am voluntarily leaving a review.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A lovely read
reviews.reviewText: Four and a half starsHIRED FOR THE BILLIONAIRE’S SECRET SON by Joss Wood is a delicious story set in Denmark. Luxury sailing vessel designer Bo Sorenson finds his orderly life tossed on its head with the appearance of a nine-month-old son he didn’t know about. Olivia Cooper is an excellent nanny to the rich and famous, and is willing to take one last short-term position before she joins the family accountancy company. It’s a match made in heaven, and not only because of their professional connection.Joss Wood writes Bo and Ollie’s attraction and burgeoning feelings well, and she deftly brings to life their passion and the heart of their conflict. Bo’s painful childhood and coolly distant relationship with his parents have shaped him and his view on connecting with people, while a tragic loss has made Ollie reluctant to share her heart again. A lovely read.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2023
reviews.reviewText: This is one I couldn't put down. Bo and Olivia go through some changes before they get their HEA.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 25, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Loved every minute
reviews.reviewText: Quickly hooked and loved every minute! Joss Wood is great at painting a vivid image of a foreign city so her reader feels like they can visualize just where her characters are at the time. With Olivia and Bo, the chemistry is instant and forbidden. I loved seeing them let their guard down with each other and grow close. The plot was easy to follow, the pace was quick but thorough and the characters were really addictive. I loved their story!I highly recommend this book to anyone that enjoys a forbidden boss romance with a whole lot of heart and drama mixed into the chemistry as they find their way towards forever.
